name: Clin T Mycosis Fungoides
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:** Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). EORTC does not include an in situ category for Mycosis Fungoides tumors.

**Note 2:** For skin
* Patch indicates any size skin lesion without significant elevation or induration
* Plaque indicates any size skin lesion that is elevated or indurated
* Tumor indicates at least one 1 centimeter (cm) diameter solid or nodular lesion with evidence of depth and/or vertical growth

**Note 3:** Assign T1 when skin involvement is present but only a general location/site is mentioned (i.e., face, torso, arms, legs). 

**Note 4:** Assign T2 If a physician describes a skin lesion of less than 1 cm as a tumor.

**Note 5:** Assign T3 if eythrodema is greater than 50%.
* Ignore erythroderma if stated to involve less than 50% of the skin

**Note 6:** Physicians use more than one method to estimate percentage of skin involvement by mycosis fungoides (MF). Code percent of skin involvement as stated by the physician.  
* If no percentage is stated and no word such as localized or generalized is used and no stage is given, code as percent not stated
footnotes:
\# TX is not defined in AJCC 7th edition.
\## T0 is not defined in AJCC 7th edition.
rows:

Skin involvement less than 10%, not stated whether plaques, papules or patches, no tumors 
    Limited plaques/patches

    Extent not stated, no tumors
    Localized, NOS

Stated as T1a

Plaques or papules, WITH or WITHOUT patches, with less than 10% of skin surface involved, no tumors

Stated as T1b
Patches, papules or plaques covering >= 10% of the skin surface

Note: T2 has subcategories of T2a and T2b. Assign T2 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Skin involvement 10% or more, not stated whether plaques, papules or patches, no tumors
Skin lesion described as tumor less than 1 cm
Generalized plaques/patches

Stated as T2 [NOS]

Patches only with 10% or more of skin surface involved

Stated as T2a

Plaques or papules, WITH or WITHOUT patches, with 10% or more of skin surface involved, no tumors

Stated as T2b
One or more tumors (>= 1 cm diameter)

Cutaneous tumor, size not stated
Generalized erythroderma 
(Greater than 50% less than 80% body surface involved with diffuse redness)

Confluence of erythema covering >=80% body surface area

Generalized erythroderma
Equal to or greater than or equal to 80% body surface involved with diffuse redness
